onboarding.subject: Urban Gardening for Small Spaces
onboarding.summary: Wants to learn how to start a productive garden in a small apartment balcony space.

profiling.focus_areas: container gardening, vertical planters, herbs, easy vegetables
profiling.notes: Learner lives in an apartment with a small balcony.

course_structure.title: The Balcony Harvest: Container Gardening for Small Apartment Spaces

phases.title: Foundations of the Balcony Ecosystem
phases.description: You will be able to assess your micro-climate and select the right containers to build a sustainable base for your garden.

lessons.title: Audit Your Balcony's Sunlight and Micro-Climate
lessons.description: Learn how to track light hours and identify wind patterns on your specific balcony.
lessons.instructional_seed: Teach the learner how to categorize their balcony as full sun, partial, or shade, emphasizing that apartment height affects wind and heat. Keep it practical with a DIY light-tracking method.

lessons.title: Choose Your Containers and Potting Mix
lessons.description: Identify the difference between gardening soil and container mix, and select pots with proper drainage.
lessons.instructional_seed: Explain why garden soil is too heavy for balcony pots; focus on the importance of drainage holes and lightweight potting mixes. Highlighting fabric pots vs. plastic for weight restrictions.

phases.title: Vegetable and Herb Selection
phases.description: You will be able to select plants that thrive in confined spaces and set them up for growth.

lessons.title: Select Reliable Herbs for Beginners
lessons.description: Pick the easiest culinary herbs that grow well in small pots, like mint, basil, and rosemary.
lessons.instructional_seed: Focus on 'pro-level' beginner herbs, explaining which ones should never be planted together (like mint in its own pot) and how to harvest them to encourage growth.

lessons.title: Pick High-Yield Compact Vegetables
lessons.description: Explore 'patio' and 'dwarf' varieties of vegetables that produce a lot of food in limited space.
lessons.instructional_seed: Introduce the learner to determinate tomatoes, leafy greens, and radishes. Emphasize why choosing 'dwarf' varieties is critical for apartment success.

phases.title: Vertical and Space-Saving Techniques
phases.description: You will be able to maximize your square footage by utilizing vertical space and trellising.

lessons.title: Install Vertical Planters and Railing Boxes
lessons.description: Learn to use the 'Z-axis' of your balcony with wall-mounted pockets and railing systems.
lessons.instructional_seed: Provide a practical guide on installing railing planters safely and using stackable towers. Focus on weight distribution to ensure balcony safety.

lessons.title: Build Simple Trellises for Climbing Plants
lessons.description: Train beans and peas to grow upward instead of outward.
lessons.instructional_seed: Teach the basics of vertical training for climbing vegetables to keep a small footprint. Use apartment-friendly materials like bamboo stakes or twine.

phases.title: Maintenance and Longevity
phases.description: You will be able to keep your plants alive, healthy, and productive through a full growing season.

lessons.title: Master Container Watering and Drainage
lessons.description: Understand the specific hydration needs of potted plants which dry out faster than the ground.
lessons.instructional_seed: Teach the 'finger test' for moisture and the importance of deep watering. Explain how to prevent water runoff from annoying neighbors below.

lessons.title: Fertilize and Manage Urban Pests
lessons.description: Learn how to feed your plants and identify common balcony bugs like aphids.
lessons.instructional_seed: Since the learner is a beginner, focus on liquid organic fertilizers and natural pest control methods like neem oil or soap sprays suitable for living spaces.
